  "description": "XFP Productions is a mission-driven organization dedicated to empowering persons with disabilities (PWDs). What began as a passion for celebrating diversity has evolved into a respected hub that actively dismantles barriers. We create platforms where creativity, ability, and opportunity intersect &mdash; transforming narratives around disability and forging pathways toward professional inclusion

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Video Editor

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	An assistantVideo Editor, or Video Production Editor, is responsible for reviewing audio and visual footage and using computer software to organize clips into a cohesive finished project.
	Their duties include splitting or combining video clips, adding appropriate sounds or graphics and watching the finished product to catch mistakes before submitting it for review.also,
	As an experienced video editor,You will collaborate with our post-production team to transform raw material into a high-quality final product. You&rsquo;ll be responsible for creating storyboards,producing short-form and long-form content,creating and adding graphics and animations.


The Assitant video editor will be assisting the Video Editor in the following :


	Edit video content for multiple outlets, including social media, YouTube, and Netflix.
	Evaluate raw footage and review shot lists and storyboards.
	Use software to enhance video footage.
	Identify ways to improve and enhance footage.
	Implement effective storytelling techniques.
	Suggest and implement appropriate special effects and music additions.
	Collaborate with video production team members.
	Proficiency with video editing software, including Adobe Final Cut Pro, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe After Effects, Adobe Premier, and Avid Media Composer.
	An advanced understanding of sound effects and special effects.
	Excellent time management skills and the ability to meet deadlines.
	Critical thinking and problem-solving talents.
	Communication skills that allow the editor to collaborate with other video production team members.
	Experience with digital video editing and motion graphics.
	Experienced in production, video editing, visual effects, cinematography, graphic design, or a related field.
	Relevant work experience focusing in the post-production process.
	Assembling raw footage and transferring or uploading to a computer.
	Assembling raw footage and transferring or uploading to a computer..
	Analyzing and following a script, screenplay or outline when performing edits.
	Inputting sound to enhance footage, which may include selecting music and writing voice-overs.
	Adding graphics to enhance footage.
	Digitally splicing film and video and synchronizing them into one rough cut file.
	Improving and correcting lighting, coloring and faulty footage.
	Working closely with Directors to present a final product that matches their vision.
	Making revisions to edits upon request.


Salary
N100,000 - N120,000 per month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hrxfactorproductions@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

        XFP Productions is a mission-driven organization dedicated to empowering persons with disabilities (PWDs). What began as a passion for celebrating diversity has evolved into a respected hub that actively dismantles barriers. We create platforms where creativity, ability, and opportunity intersect — transforming narratives around disability and forging pathways toward professional inclusion

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Video Editor

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	An assistantVideo Editor, or Video Production Editor, is responsible for reviewing audio and visual footage and using computer software to organize clips into a cohesive finished project.
	Their duties include splitting or combining video clips, adding appropriate sounds or graphics and watching the finished product to catch mistakes before submitting it for review.also,
	As an experienced video editor,You will collaborate with our post-production team to transform raw material into a high-quality final product. You’ll be responsible for creating storyboards,producing short-form and long-form content,creating and adding graphics and animations.


The Assitant video editor will be assisting the Video Editor in the following :


	Edit video content for multiple outlets, including social media, YouTube, and Netflix.
	Evaluate raw footage and review shot lists and storyboards.
	Use software to enhance video footage.
	Identify ways to improve and enhance footage.
	Implement effective storytelling techniques.
	Suggest and implement appropriate special effects and music additions.
	Collaborate with video production team members.
	Proficiency with video editing software, including Adobe Final Cut Pro, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe After Effects, Adobe Premier, and Avid Media Composer.
	An advanced understanding of sound effects and special effects.
	Excellent time management skills and the ability to meet deadlines.
	Critical thinking and problem-solving talents.
	Communication skills that allow the editor to collaborate with other video production team members.
	Experience with digital video editing and motion graphics.
	Experienced in production, video editing, visual effects, cinematography, graphic design, or a related field.
	Relevant work experience focusing in the post-production process.
	Assembling raw footage and transferring or uploading to a computer.
	Assembling raw footage and transferring or uploading to a computer..
	Analyzing and following a script, screenplay or outline when performing edits.
	Inputting sound to enhance footage, which may include selecting music and writing voice-overs.

	Digitally splicing film and video and synchronizing them into one rough cut file.
	Improving and correcting lighting, coloring and faulty footage.
	Working closely with Directors to present a final product that matches their vision.
	Making revisions to edits upon request.


Salary
N100,000 - N120,000 per month.

	The General Manager will be responsible for overseeing the overall operations, growth, and performance of the events and catering company. This role ensures efficient event execution, strong team leadership, excellent client service, and effective cost management to achieve business objectives.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee daily operations of the events and catering business to ensure smooth service delivery.

	Control operational costs, budgets, and pricing to maintain profitability.
	Manage inventory of food supplies, equipment, and event materials.
	Develop and implement standard operating procedures for events and catering services.
	Handle key client relationships and resolve escalated customer complaints professionally.
	Coordinate staff recruitment, training, scheduling, and performance management.
	Ensure compliance with health, safety, hygiene, and regulatory standards.

  "description": "Matna Foods Limited is a leading agro-allied food processing company focused on the production of high-quality, food-grade cassava starch for both local and international markets. Nigeria&rsquo;s pioneer producer of international-standard, multi-use cassava starch, Matna operates a modern processing facility near Akure, Ondo State, strategically located within a major cassava-producing belt.

Matna&rsquo;s operations are anchored on strong process discipline, rigorous quality control, safety standards, and operational excellence required to meet demanding global specifications. By combining advanced processing technology, deep agricultural linkages, and skilled professionals, the company consistently delivers reliable, high-grade starch for a wide range of food and industrial applications.
Driven by a commitment to quality, innovation, and continuous improvement, Matna&rsquo;s products remain highly competitive across domestic and export markets. The company&rsquo;s growth has been guided by visionary leadership and a strong belief in the potential of Nigeria&rsquo;s agricultural value chain&mdash;earning industry recognition, including the CBN Export Category Best SMEEIS Entrepreneur Award. At Matna, we are committed to building a high-performance culture that attracts, develops, and empowers talented professionals who share our passion for excellence, collaboration, and innovation&mdash;creating an environment where ideas thrive, and standards are continually raised.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Electrical Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Akure, Ondo

	We are seeking talented professionals who are passionate about socio-economic development through agricultural and Agro-allied investments.&nbsp;
	The Electrical Manager is responsible for ensuring reliable, safe, and efficient electrical systems that sustain uninterrupted factory operations and support Matna&rsquo;s production discipline, quality standards, and cost efficiency.
	This role provides technical leadership over all electrical infrastructure, equipment, and power systems within the processing plant, ensuring that electrical reliability directly contributes to reduced downtime, optimal equipment performance, and stable production flow.
	The Electrical Manager works closely with Production, Maintenance, QA, and Safety teams to maintain a high-performance operating environment.


Responsibilities


	Lead the maintenance, reliability, and performance of all electrical systems, panels, motors, drives, and control systems within the plant
	Ensure stable power supply and proper load management to prevent production interruptions
	Plan and implement preventive and corrective electrical maintenance to minimize equipment downtime
	Support production efficiency by ensuring electrical systems enable optimal equipment operation and process flow
	Supervise installation, testing, and commissioning of electrical equipment and upgrades
	Enforce strict electrical safety standards and compliance across all plant activities
	Collaborate with maintenance and production teams to quickly diagnose and resolve electrical faults affecting operations
	Maintain accurate documentation of electrical systems, maintenance schedules, and technical records
	Support energy management initiatives to reduce power waste and improve cost efficiency
	Guide and supervise electrical technicians and contractors to ensure high technical standards and process discipline
	Ensure availability of critical electrical spares and proper inventory management.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree or HND in Electrical Engineering or related field
	8&ndash;12 years of experience in electrical maintenance within FMCG, food processing, agro-processing, or industrial manufacturing
	Strong experience with industrial motors, control panels, drives, PLC systems, and power distribution
	Proven ability to manage electrical reliability in a factory or processing environment
	Good understanding of preventive maintenance systems and equipment uptime management
	Strong knowledge of electrical safety standards and compliance practices
	Experience supervising technical teams and contractors
	Ability to troubleshoot complex electrical issues under production pressure
	High level of technical discipline, attention to detail, and problem-solving capability
	Proficiency in technical documentation and maintenance reporting


Benefits


	Competitive Compensation. &nbsp;&nbsp;

	Competitive Health Insurance (Employee + Spouse + 4 children). &nbsp;&nbsp;
	Wellness Programs &nbsp;&nbsp;
	Employee Training Programs &nbsp;&nbsp;
	Growth and Development &nbsp;&nbsp;
	Mentoring and Counseling.

Electrical Manager Job at Matna Foods Limited




        
    

        
        Matna Foods Limited is a leading agro-allied food processing company focused on the production of high-quality, food-grade cassava starch for both local and international markets. Nigeria’s pioneer producer of international-standard, multi-use cassava starch, Matna operates a modern processing facility near Akure, Ondo State, strategically located within a major cassava-producing belt.
     

            
    



Matna’s operations are anchored on strong process discipline, rigorous quality control, safety standards, and operational excellence required to meet demanding global specifications. By combining advanced processing technology, deep agricultural linkages, and skilled professionals, the company consistently delivers reliable, high-grade starch for a wide range of food and industrial applications.
Driven by a commitment to quality, innovation, and continuous improvement, Matna’s products remain highly competitive across domestic and export markets. The company’s growth has been guided by visionary leadership and a strong belief in the potential of Nigeria’s agricultural value chain—earning industry recognition, including the CBN Export Category Best SMEEIS Entrepreneur Award. At Matna, we are committed to building a high-performance culture that attracts, develops, and empowers talented professionals who share our passion for excellence, collaboration, and innovation—creating an environment where ideas thrive, and standards are continually raised.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Electrical Manager

Job Location: Akure, Ondo

Job Description


	We are seeking talented professionals who are passionate about socio-economic development through agricultural and Agro-allied investments. 
	The Electrical Manager is responsible for ensuring reliable, safe, and efficient electrical systems that sustain uninterrupted factory operations and support Matna’s production discipline, quality standards, and cost efficiency.
	This role provides technical leadership over all electrical infrastructure, equipment, and power systems within the processing plant, ensuring that electrical reliability directly contributes to reduced downtime, optimal equipment performance, and stable production flow.
	The Electrical Manager works closely with Production, Maintenance, QA, and Safety teams to maintain a high-performance operating environment.


Responsibilities


	Lead the maintenance, reliability, and performance of all electrical systems, panels, motors, drives, and control systems within the plant
	Ensure stable power supply and proper load management to prevent production interruptions
	Plan and implement preventive and corrective electrical maintenance to minimize equipment downtime
	Support production efficiency by ensuring electrical systems enable optimal equipment operation and process flow
	Supervise installation, testing, and commissioning of electrical equipment and upgrades
	Enforce strict electrical safety standards and compliance across all plant activities
	Collaborate with maintenance and production teams to quickly diagnose and resolve electrical faults affecting operations
	Maintain accurate documentation of electrical systems, maintenance schedules, and technical records
	Support energy management initiatives to reduce power waste and improve cost efficiency
	Guide and supervise electrical technicians and contractors to ensure high technical standards and process discipline
	Ensure availability of critical electrical spares and proper inventory management.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree or HND in Electrical Engineering or related field
	8–12 years of experience in electrical maintenance within FMCG, food processing, agro-processing, or industrial manufacturing
	Strong experience with industrial motors, control panels, drives, PLC systems, and power distribution
	Proven ability to manage electrical reliability in a factory or processing environment
	Good understanding of preventive maintenance systems and equipment uptime management
	Strong knowledge of electrical safety standards and compliance practices
	Experience supervising technical teams and contractors
	Ability to troubleshoot complex electrical issues under production pressure
	High level of technical discipline, attention to detail, and problem-solving capability
	Proficiency in technical documentation and maintenance reporting


Benefits


	Competitive Compensation.   
	5-day workweek.   
	Competitive Health Insurance (Employee + Spouse + 4 children).   
	Wellness Programs   
	Employee Training Programs   
	Growth and Development   
	Mentoring and Counseling.
